priorVersion.title: CDISC Questionnaire T1-DDS Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C161620

self.title: CDISC Questionnaire T1-DDS Test Name Terminology

definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes test name.
name: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes Questionnaire Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire T1-DDS Test Name Terminology
synonyms: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes Questionnaire Test Name

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I've got to be perfect with my diabetes management.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Be Perfect With Diabetes Management

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I can't ever be safe from the possibility of a serious hypoglycemic event.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Be Safe From Hypoglycemic Event

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I can't tell my diabetes doctor what is really on my mind.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Can't Tell Doctor What on My Mind
terms.submissionValue: DDS01-Can't Tell Doctor What on My Mind
synonyms: DDS01-Can't Tell Doctor What on My Mind

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling discouraged when I see high blood glucose numbers that I can't explain.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Discouraged See High Blood Glucose

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my diabetes doctor doesn't know enough about diabetes and diabetes care.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Doctor Doesn't Know Enough

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my diabetes doctor doesn't really understand what it's like to have diabetes.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Doctor Doesn't Understand

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I don't check my blood glucose level as often as I probably should.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Don't Check Glucose as I Should
terms.submissionValue: DDS01-Don't Check Glucose as I Should
synonyms: DDS01-Don't Check Glucose as I Should

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I don't get help I really need from my diabetes doctor about managing diabetes.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Don't Get Help From Doctor

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I don't give my diabetes as much attention as I probably should.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Don't Give Diabetes Attention

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I don't notice the warning signs of hypoglycemia as well as I used to.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Don't Notice Signs of Hypoglycemia

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my eating is out of control.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Eating Is Out of Control

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my friends or family act like 'diabetes police' (bother me too much).
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Family Act Like Diabetes Police

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my family and friends make a bigger deal out of diabetes than they should.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Family Make Bigger Deal Diabetes

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my friends or family treat me as if I were more fragile or sicker than I really am.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Family Treat Me More Fragile

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that my friends and family worry more about hypoglycemia than I want them to.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Family Worry About Hypoglycemia

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that thoughts about food and eating control my life.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Food and Eating Control My Life
terms.submissionValue: DDS01-Food and Eating Control My Life
synonyms: DDS01-Food and Eating Control My Life

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling like I have to hide my diabetes from other people.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Have to Hide My Diabetes

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling frightened that I could have a serious hypoglycemic event when I'm asleep.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Hypoglycemic Event When Asleep

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling frightened that I could have a serious hypoglycemic event while driving.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Hypoglycemic Event While Driving

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I don't eat as carefully as I probably should.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - I Don't Eat Carefully as I Should
terms.submissionValue: DDS01-I Don't Eat Carefully as I Should
synonyms: DDS01-I Don't Eat Carefully as I Should

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling concerned that diabetes may make me less attractive to employers.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Less Attractive to Employers

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that no matter how hard I try with my diabetes, it will never be good enough.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Never Be Good Enough

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I am not as skilled at managing diabetes as I should be.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Not Skilled at Managing Diabetes

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that I am not taking as much insulin as I should.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Not Taking Insulin as I Should
terms.submissionValue: DDS01-Not Taking Insulin as I Should
synonyms: DDS01-Not Taking Insulin as I Should

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that people will think less of me if they knew I had diabetes.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - People Think Less of Me

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that people treat me differently when they find out I have diabetes.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - People Treat Me Differently

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 1 - Powerlessness.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 1: Powerlessness

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 2 - Management distress.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 2: Management Distress

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 3 - Hypoglycemia distress.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 3: Hypoglycemia Distress

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 4 - Negative social perceptions.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 4: Negative Social Perceptions

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 5 - Eating distress.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 5: Eating Distress

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 6 - Physician distress.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 6: Physician Distress

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Subscale 7 - Friend/family distress.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Subscale 7: Friend/Family Distress

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling that there is too much diabetes equipment and stuff I must always have with me.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Too Much Diabetes Equipment With Me

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Total scale.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Total Scale

terms.definition: Diabetes Distress Scale for Adults with Type 1 Diabetes - Over the past month, please indicate the degree to which each of the following may have been a problem for you: Feeling worried that I will develop serious long-term complications, no matter how hard I try.
terms.preferredTerm: T1-DDS - Worried Develop Complications
